betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Redstone Dust is a wonderful substance, but it has several limitations that give you a headache sometimes. To that end you've tried to crystallize redstone dust the same way you crystallize the primal shards, thinking this would solve your problems.

Unfortunately that attempt was not successful. The redstone crystal lost all of it's redstone properties, but with a bit of tweaking you've come up with this functional recipe.

Redcrystal can be placed directly against a wall or ceiling, and also allows you to use a wand to toggle whether a given side sends/receives any redstone signals. This allows for nice and compact builds in places regular redstone couldn't even exist in the first place.

You wonder if it is possible to further improve these redcrystals, to allow them to manipulate or process the signal they're receiving in some way...
